step1.sentence: I was so busy with the project deadline that I had to skip a meal and just grabbed a coffee instead.

step2.story: Jenna glanced at the clock and realized it was already 3 PM. She had been so absorbed in writing her thesis that she completely forgot about lunch. She knew it wasn't healthy to skip a meal, but the final deadline was only hours away.

step3.story: Daniel stared at the pile of reports on his desk and sighed. His stomach growled loudly, reminding him that he hadn't eaten since last night. His coworker Sarah walked by and noticed his pale face. "You really shouldn't skip a meal like that," she said, placing a sandwich on his desk. Daniel smiled weakly and took a bite, instantly feeling some energy return. He made a mental note to set a lunch alarm from now on, no matter how hectic work got.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 식사를 건너뛰다, 즉 한 끼를 먹지 않고 넘기는 것을 의미합니다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 바쁘거나 다이어트 등의 이유로 아침, 점심, 저녁 중 한 끼를 의도적으로 또는 어쩔 수 없이 먹지 않을 때 사용합니다. 일상 대화에서 매우 자주 쓰이는 표현입니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 'skip'은 '건너뛰다'라는 뜻의 동사이고, 'meal'은 '식사'를 의미합니다. 두 단어가 결합하여 '식사를 한 번 거르다'라는 자연스러운 연어(collocation)를 이룹니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 중립적인 표현이지만, 건강에 좋지 않다는 뉘앙스가 함께 전달되는 경우가 많습니다. 'miss a meal'과 비슷하지만 skip은 좀 더 의도적인 느낌이 있습니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: Don't skip a meal just because you're trying to lose weight.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 살을 빼려고 한다고 식사를 건너뛰지 마세요.
